def_cn: 巩固(地位);增强，加强(实力)
def_en: If something strengthens a person or group or if they strengthen their position, they become more powerful and secure, or more likely to succeed.

def_cn: 支持，强化(论点或论据);使更有说服力
def_en: If something strengthens a case or argument, it supports it by providing more reasons or evidence for it.

def_cn: (使)(经济、工业)坚挺，壮大;(使)(货币)升值
def_en: If a currency, economy, or industry strengthens, or if something strengthens it, it increases in value or becomes more successful.

def_cn: 加强，加大(法律、措施)的力度;(使)变得更严格
def_en: If a government strengthens laws or measures or if they strengthen, they are made more severe.

def_cn: 增强(决心或毅力);使更具信心;使更加坚定
def_en: If something strengthens you or strengthens your resolve or character, it makes you more confident and determined.

def_cn: 增进(关系或联系);(使)变得更紧密
def_en: If something strengthens a relationship or link, or if a relationship or link strengthens, it makes it closer and more likely to last for a long time.

def_cn: 加强，加深(印象、感情、信念);(使)变得比较深刻;(使)坚定
def_en: If something strengthens an impression, feeling, or belief, or if it strengthens, it becomes greater or affects more people.
If something strengthens your body or a part of your body, it makes it healthier, often in such a way that you can move or carry heavier things.
If something strengthens an object or structure, it makes it able to be treated roughly or able to support heavy weights, without being damaged or destroyed.
If the wind, current, or other force strengthens, it becomes faster or more powerful.
